page.title: 08Hole Carr Farm, Heathylee
page.content: The house that I did a survey on was called Hole Carr Farm. The land at this farm is mostly rough pasture which is used for sheep grazing. The people put the sheep on the rough pasture because sheep will eat almost anything. For example they will eat rushes, heather and maybe even gorse and thorns. Some of the land is also used for meadow and normal pasture. Round this farm there isn't any woodland. The people who live at the farm have lots of dogs which seem nasty. At this farm they only have mains electricity. They also have their own transport. Seven people live at the house - 2 adults and 5 children.
